agency_name: MIGRANT REGIONAL SERVICE CENTER - REGION 1 (SOUTH BEND COMMUNITY SCHOOL CORPORATION)
agency_desc: An agency that helps migratory children in northern Indiana overcome educational disruption, various health-related problems, and other factors that inhibit the ability of such children to do well in school and make a successful transition to postsecondary education or employment.
site_name: MIGRANT REGIONAL SERVICE CENTER - REGION 1 (SOUTH BEND COMMUNITY SCHOOL CORPORATION)
address_1: 215 Doctor Martin Luther King Junior Boulevard
service_description: Helps migrant students overcome educational disruption, various health-related problems, and other factors that inhibit the ability of such students to do well in school and make a successful transition to postsecondary education or employment.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an interview.
site_eligibility: Children age 3-21 years -- Moved across school district lines, either by themselves, or with a parent or guardian, to obtain qualifying seasonal or temporary agricultural work -- Currently living in Adams, Allen, DeKalb,, Elkhart, Fulton, Huntington, Jasper, Kosciusko, LaGrange, Lake, La Porte,, Marshall, Newton, Noble, Porter, Pulaski, St Joseph, Starke, Steuben, Wabash, Wells, or Whitley County

agency_name: INDIANA HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY - BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE
agency_desc: This is not a true agency record, but rather a collection of lead regional agencies providing coordinated entry services to individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
site_name: REGION 2A - LEAD AGENCY AND QUARANTINE SHELTER CONTACT - CENTER FOR THE HOMELESS
service_name: COORDINATED ENTRY - CENTER FOR THE HOMELESS
service_description: Leads housing intake, assessment, referrals, and placement coordination for individuals and families experiencing homelessness (including those requiring quarantine shelter).
nameLevel3: At Risk/Homeless Housing Related Assistance Programs
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in St Joseph County -- Currently and chronically homeless (living on the street, unable to obtain shelter, or living in uninhabitable conditions)

agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
site_name: REAL SERVICES - SOUTH BEND
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Elkhart, Kosciusko, LaPorte, Marshall, and St. Joseph County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Elkhart, Kosciusko, LaPorte, Marshall, or St. Joseph County

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization offering various programs to strengthen families.
site_name: CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF FORT WAYNE-SOUTH BEND - SOUTH BEND OFFICE
service_description: Offers case management services to assist clients in setting and meeting goals and building skills while working toward financial self-sufficiency. Provides limited financial assistance for utilities, rent, and other basic needs by assessment. Program also offers assistance to meet basic needs such as work shoes/boots, clothing, personal hygiene items, cleaning or laundry supplies, diapers (baby or adult), . Case managers will assist in accessing community and public resources, financial literacy, job readiness skills, school/ GED enrollment or other goals.
site_details: Call to make an appointment OR visit the website to complete an application
site_eligibility: Income at or below 250% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines

agency_name: CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF FORT WAYNE - SOUTH BEND

service_description: Provides case management services to pregnant or parenting teens and young adults working to maintain or improve academic performance in high school or college. Interested persons may self-refer or may be referred by a school counselor or physician. Parental consent is required for participating minors. Home- and school-based services are provided.
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment. -- Professionals should call to refer by phone or to request a referral form.
site_eligibility: Age 13-24 -- Pregnant or parenting -- Enrolled in high school or college

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides employment training and support services for migrant and seasonal farm workers.
site_name: PROTEUS - SOUTH BEND OFFICE
service_name: NATIONAL FARMWORKER JOBS PROGRAM - NORTHERN REGION
service_description: Provides employment and training services and educational funding for qualified migrant, seasonal farm workers and agricultural workers. A wide variety of support services are available to participants in the program.
site_details: Call for information and assistance.
site_eligibility: Living in Bartholomew, Brown, Clark, Dearborn, Decatur, Fayette, Floyd, Franklin, Harrison, Jackson, Jefferson, Jennings, Ohio, Ripley, Rush, Scott, Switzerland, Union, and Washington County -- Migrant and seasonal farm workers and agricultural workers -- Having a low income determination or disability -- Authorized to work in the United States, including all US territories

agency_desc: A commercial organization that offers services for treating substance use disorder.

service_name: SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER SERVICE - SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient substance abuse treatment for adults. Services include educational groups, outpatient counseling, intensive outpatient treatment, and relapse prevention.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Seeking information or treatment for substance use disorder

Sliding-scale fees for qualifying low-income, uninsured clients.

agency_desc: Community mental health center serving Elkhart and St. Joseph counties.
site_name: OAKLAWN RECOVERY CAFE - SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides resources, support group, social activities, and community of care to those in recovery. Services are designed to maintain sobriety and prevent relapse by reducing social isolation, providing positive modeling behaviors, encouraging honest feedback, and increasing emotional support.
site_details: Visit website or call for information.
site_eligibility: Individuals struggling with substance abuse, mental illness, incarceration, homelessness, grief, or similar issue -- Drug and alcohol-free for a minimum of 24 hours before coming to the cafe -- Participate in at least one Recovery Circle (meetings to work on goals, build relationships, and focus on sobriety) per week.

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
site_name: INDIANA LEGAL SERVICES - SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides legal guidance and representation to low-income individuals in civil matters, such as family law, senior law, consumer law, housing issues, and public benefits. Preference is given to legal problems that prevent clients from meeting their basic needs. No criminal or fee-generating cases accepted.
site_details: Call during service hours to begin the application process or apply online.
site_eligibility: Income 125% of Federal Poverty Level -- With a civil legal issue that does not generate fees

agency_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency providing services for individuals with developmental disabilities.
site_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - DISTRICT 2
service_name: HOME AND COMMUNITY BASED MEDICAID WAIVERS / CAREGIVER SUPPORT SERVICES - DISTRICT 2
service_description: Provides funding for home and residential care services to enable persons with developmental disabilities to live as independently as possible. Client services include developmental evaluation; case management; and referrals to supported living, sheltered employment, and home-care providers. There is a wait list for Medicaid Waivers; however, caregiver support services funds may be available in the meantime.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: With a developmental disability, including intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, epilepsy, autism, down syndrome, or a condition that results in a similar impairment -- Onset for the condition was prior to age 22 -- The disability creates substantial functional limitations (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing home-based case management.
site_name: SCAN - REGION 3
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY - REGION 3
service_description: Provides home-based case management services to help at-risk families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call to request service or visit website to complete a referral form.
site_eligibility: With one or more child under age 18 -- Low income, at risk, or in need of services -- Not eligible for the Healthy Families program -- Without an active Child Protective Services case -- Without a child in the home who is currently on juvenile probation

site_eligibility: With one or more child under age 18 -- Low income, at risk, or in need of services -- Not eligible for the Healthy Families program -- Without an active Child Protective Services case -- Without a child in the home who is currently on juvenile probation

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing home-based case management.

agency_desc: A community college offering certifications and associate degrees.
site_name: IVY TECH COMMUNITY COLLEGE - SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides low-cost basic dental services performed by students under the direction of licensed hygienists and dentists. Services include x-rays, exams, cleaning, fluoride, and sealants. No fillings, extractions, or other repairs/treatment.
site_details: Call for appointment. Plan on appointments lasting up to four hours.
site_schedule: Office: Vary -- Services: by appointment only
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
site_name: VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION SERVICES - AREA 4
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: The state government entity responsible for state tax matters, including collecting state taxes, administering state tax laws, and creating tax policy.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE - SOUTH BEND DISTRICT
service_description: Answers questions about state income taxes, provides state tax forms, handles state tax collections and assists with setting up payment arrangements, and submits completed state tax returns (paper filing only). Assistance is provided by phone, email, or on a walk-in basis. Automated information is available 24 hours per day by phone.
site_details: Walk in, call, or send questions by email. -- For phone assistance, follow the phone prompts to hear recorded information by topic or to speak with a live representative. State or federal tax ID number may be required.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The Indiana Department of Health supports Indiana's economic prosperity and quality of life by promoting, protecting, and providing for the health of Hoosiers in their communities.
site_name: BREAST AND CERVICAL CANCER PROGRAM (BCCP) - NORTHERN REGION
address_2: United Health Services, Building 9, Mail Unit 10
service_description: Provides access to free or low-cost breast and cervical cancer screenings, diagnostic testing, and treatment for women who are uninsured or underinsured. Services provided may include colposcopies, liquid-based cytology tests, high risk panel HPV testing, office visits, pelvic exams/tests, clinical breast exams (CBEs), screening and/or diagnostic mammograms, diagnostic breast ultrasounds, breast biopsies, and consultations. Regional coordinators conduct eligibility assessments and provide referrals to local care providers as well as Medicaid (MA-12) Option 3 Treatment Program enrollment assistance (for those who receive a cancer diagnosis).
site_details: Visit website for additional information and income guidelines. -- Call to request an eligibility assessment.
site_eligibility:
For BCCP: Female resident of Indiana -- With household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Uninsured or underinsured (such as having a high or unmet deductible)

For Services: Age 30-49 for office visit, clinical breast exam, and Pap smear -- Age 50-64 for office visit, clinical breast exam, Pap smear, and mammogram -- Age 65 or older and not enrolled in Medicare Part B for office visit, clinical breast exam, Pap test, and mammogram

For MA-12 Option 3 Treatment Program: Female residents of Indiana -- Age 18-64 -- Diagnosed with breast or cervical cancer -- Entering or actively receiving treatment -- Not enrolled in Medicare -- Uninsured or with insurance not covering cancer treatment -- With household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
site_name: BOWEN CENTER - ELKHART COUNTY
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: YOUTH SERVICE BUREAU OF ST JOSEPH COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit, multi-service youth organization that offers support services and respite to children and youth during crisis situations.
site_name: YOUTH SERVICE BUREAU OF ST JOSEPH COUNTY
service_description: Offers home-based case management for young mothers (ages 16-24), their children, and the father of the child, as appropriate. Services focus on crisis reduction, life skills, and parenting education. The program offers monthly group education and support meetings for persons in need.
site_details: Call for an appointment to begin an initial assessment and possibly be placed on waitlist.
site_eligibility: Pregnant or parenting youth -- Age 16-24 -- Living in Saint Joseph County

agency_desc: A nonprofit, multi-service youth organization that offers support services and respite to children and youth during crisis situations.
site_name: SAFE STATION
service_description: Offers a short-term, emergency shelter for youth (age 12-18), who are runaways, homeless, or in another crisis that leads to the need for shelter. Parents under stress may voluntarily place children for respite. The shelter operates daily 24 hours and children may stay up to 21 days. Other support services include counseling and case management. A parental consent form must be completed within 48 hours.
site_details: Call for intake appointment.

service_description: Provides street outreach and a drop-in center for homeless, runaway, and at-risk youth. Services include snack, laundry access, hygiene supplies, and case management. Referrals are available for education, job placement, and other community resources.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_schedule: Tues, Wed, and Fri 2pm-6pm; Sat noon-6pm
site_eligibility: Homeless or at risk homeless youth -- Ages 21 or younger

service_description: Trains, supervises, and monitors volunteers to serve as advocates and provide crisis intervention for abused or neglected adults and their families in St Joseph County. Advocates provide hospital accompaniment and are available 24 hours. Volunteers undergo 33 hours of training.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 years or older -- Able to pass criminal background checks -- Able to commit to the time involved for training and service

agency_desc: A nonprofit that provides transitional living for men and women who are in recovery from substance use disorders.
site_name: THE UPPER ROOM
service_description: Provides transitional housing for men and women who are in recovery from substance use disorders. Services include case management, education, and job skills training. Residents must attend and participate in house meetings and support groups. Employment or source of income should be obtained within 60 days of entering the program. There is no restriction on the length of stay.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment. -- Applications may be downloaded from the website.
site_eligibility: Men and Women -- Age 18 or older -- Recovering from abuse of alcohol or narcotic substances -- Referred from probation, court, or a social service agency (Life Treatment, Oaklawn, etc.)

agency_name: CENTRE TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - ST. JOSEPH COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: CENTRE TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - ST. JOSEPH COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_name: GREENE TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - ST. JOSEPH COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF ST JOSEPH COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF ST JOSEPH COUNTY
service_description: Builds and rehabilitates homes for eligible low-income persons. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call for application meeting schedule.
site_eligibility: Household income between area median (Call or see website for current amounts.) -- Stable employment for the past two years or other source of income (such SSDI, SSI, etc) -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: A public transit providing fixed routes and paratransit services for the cities of South Bend and Mishawaka.
site_name: SOUTH BEND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION CORPORATION
service_description: Provides curb-to-curb, reservations-based transportation throughout Mishawaka and South Bend city for certified customers who, because of a disability, are unable to use Transpo's regular fixed-route system.
site_details: Walk in, call, or visit the website to request an application; must complete entirely. -- Reservations for members must be scheduled at least a day in advance, but no more than two weeks ahead.

agency_name: ELKHART AND ST JOSEPH COUNTIES HEAD START CONSORTIUM
agency_desc: A consortium of 11 school districts providing early childhood education to local area families.
site_name: ELKHART AND ST JOSEPH COUNTIES HEAD START CONSORTIUM
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. Children with special needs or disabilities may apply. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Half- day options; transportation available.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility: Age 3-5 years-old (Age 3 by August 1st) -- Household income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_name: ELKHART AND ST JOSEPH COUNTIES HEAD START CONSORTIUM
agency_desc: A consortium of 11 school districts providing early childhood education to local area families.
site_name: ELKHART AND ST JOSEPH COUNTIES HEAD START CONSORTIUM
service_description: Provides prenatal and early childhood support through a home-based program that combines parenting education, economic self-sufficiency planning, and health and social services for low-income families.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility:
Age 2 weeks up to 3 years (but not yet 3) -- Household income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level
*2 WEEKS OLD TO 2 YEARS

service_name: EARLY HEAD START - TEEN MOM PROGRAM
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children of teen parent families. The program is delivered full day throughout the year and can be a combination of center-based and home-based services.
taxonomy_name: School Based Teen Parent/Pregnant Teen Programs
nameLevel3: School Based Teen Parent/Pregnant Teen Programs
site_details: Visit the website or call the office and schedule an appointment to complete an application.
site_eligibility: Age 2 weeks up to 3 years (but not yet 3) -- Household income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Parent enrolled in school

service_description: Provides warm meals twice daily to all in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An independent residential ministry of the Christian community working primarily with homeless and low-income persons by providing shelter, meals, casework and spiritual guidance.
site_name: HOPE MINISTRIES - FAMILY LIFE CENTER
service_description: Provides shelter for homeless men, women, with or without children in need. Support services include three daily meals, basic medical care, job search assistance, and assistance in finding permanent housing.
site_details: Call to check shelter availability. --
site_eligibility: Men -- Women -- Age 18 or older -- With or without children

agency_desc: An independent residential ministry of the Christian community working primarily with homeless and low-income persons by providing shelter, meals, casework and spiritual guidance.
site_name: HOPE MINISTRIES - FAMILY LIFE CENTER
service_description: Provides transitional housing for families and single women with or without children. Apartment-based living is offered. Support services include three meals per day, basic medical care, job search assistance, and assistance in finding permanent housing.
site_details: Walk in to fill out an application for the wait list.
site_eligibility: Couples with children -- single women, with or without children

agency_desc: An independent residential ministry of the Christian community working primarily with homeless and low-income persons by providing shelter, meals, casework and spiritual guidance.
site_name: HELP WITH LOVE
service_description: Matches persons in need of assistance with volunteer programs through partnering churches. Depending on available resources, referrals may be provided for food, clothing, hygiene items, prescription refills, child care, transportation, wheelchair ramp construction, home repairs, errands/shopping, and yard work. Immediate assistance is not available.
site_details: Call to leave a voicemail or email to make a request. -- Provide reason for needing assistance and contact information -- Volunteers will call back to do an intake and possibly schedule a home visit.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals and re-homes animals through adoption.
site_name: HUMANE SOCIETY OF ST JOSEPH COUNTY
service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items often include pet food, used towels, kitten litter, newspaper, paper goods, and aluminum cans for recycling. Volunteers to assist with shelter duties are also welcome.
site_details: Call or walk in to make donation arrangements or to inquire about volunteering.
site_eligibility: To Donate: Open -- To Volunteer: Call for information.

agency_name: HUMANE SOCIETY OF ST JOSEPH COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals and re-homes animals through adoption.
site_name: HUMANE SOCIETY OF ST JOSEPH COUNTY
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances except for the city of South Bend, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, micro-chipping of pets, humane euthanasia for terminally ill pets, and adoption for homeless dogs and cats. Issues pet licenses in St Joseph County, except for the city of South Bend.
site_details: To Report an Animal Violation (Stray, Endangered, etc.): call the shelter to make a report; for after-hours emergencies call After-Hours Dispatch. -- To Surrender an Animal: walk in or call in advance during shelter hours. -- To claim an Impounded Animal: call in advance or walk in during shelter hours.
site_schedule: Mon-Sat 8:30am-5:30pm -- After-Hours Emergency Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

site_name: HUMANE SOCIETY OF ST JOSEPH COUNTY
service_description: Provides temporary emergency shelter for pets, with an owner in crisis. Services are exclusive to help victims of domestic violence leave abusive situations and at-risk homeless persons, pending eviction, entering shelter, or evacuating house fire. Placement is based on foster availability. Fees are on a case by case basis.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Sat 8:30am-5:30pm -- After-Hours Emergency Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: At-risk homeless (pending eviction, fleeing domestic violence, or evacuating a house fire) -- In need of temporary placement of dog or cat in order to leave an unsafe home

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.

service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.
site_details: Call to make a report; provide as much detail about the situation as possible. -- For emergencies or after-hours reports, please call local police or county dispatch.
site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for the city of Mishawaka in St Joseph County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals. Also accepts reports about abandoned vehicles on private property.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; services limited to properties within Mishawaka city limits

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
site_name: MISHAWAKA ENVIROMENTAL CENTER
service_description: Offers a drop-off site for properly disposing of hazardous household waste products, including paints, waste oils, solvents, fuels, corrosives, poisons, pesticides, tires, aerosol, and electronics. This site will also accept small amounts of yard waste.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Mishawaka

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
site_name: MISHAWAKA PARKS AND RECREATION
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Mishawaka in St Joseph County. Programs vary by season, but may include  team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
site_name: MISHAWAKA UTILITIES
service_description: Provides electric, water, trash, and sanitary sewer utility services for the city of Mishawaka in St Joseph County.
site_details: Walk in or call to request new service. Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at the south side of the building.
site_eligibility: Open; primarily serves Mishawaka city limits and some surrounding areas

agency_desc: A nonprofit food bank that serves charities helping people in need with food.
site_name: FOOD BANK OF NORTHERN INDIANA
service_description: Provides nonperishable and perishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in St. Joseph County -- Limit one visit every 30 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit food bank that serves charities helping people in need with food.
site_name: FOOD BANK OF NORTHERN INDIANA
service_description: Acts as a clearinghouse for donated food products, providing inspection, storage, handling and redistribution to church food pantries, shelters, soup kitchens, residential treatment centers, and other eligible nonprofit organizations in Elkhart, Kosciusko, La Porte, Marshall, Starke, and St Joseph County in Northern Indiana.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Northern Indiana agencies with 501(c)(3) tax exempt rating

agency_desc: A nonprofit food bank that serves charities helping people in need with food.
site_name: FOOD BANK OF NORTHERN INDIANA
service_description: Provides supplemental food to qualified seniors in need in St Joseph County. Food items may include fresh produce, dairy, and frozen meats. Special diets may be accommodated. Limit one food box per household. Clients must pre-register for this service.
site_details: Call for information and site locations. -- Precertification required.
site_eligibility: Living in Elkhart, La Porte, Marshall, or St. Joseph County -- Age 60 or older -- At or below 130% of the federal poverty level

agency_desc: A nonprofit food bank that serves charities helping people in need with food.
site_name: FOOD BANK OF NORTHERN INDIANA - MOBILE FOOD PANTRY LOCATOR
service_description: Provides a nonperishable and perishable mobile pantry to those in need.
site_details:
Visit agency's website and click on mobile food distributions to access list of mobile food pantry sites, dates, and times.

Drive through for service. -- An area is available for self-loading if trunk does not open.
site_schedule: Varies by site; refer to agency's website
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: ST JOSEPH COUNTY VETERANS SERVICE OFFICE
agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
site_name: ST JOSEPH COUNTY VETERANS SERVICE
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_name: CHRIST CHILD SOCIETY OF SOUTH BEND
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization of volunteers dedicated to providing clothing to children.
site_name: CHRIST CHILD SOCIETY OF SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides free seasonal and cold-weather clothing items and shoes for St. Joseph County children (ages newborn through age 13) in need. Donations accepted year-round.
site_details: Visit https://www.christchildsb.org/calendar-of-events/clothing-center-open-days-for-referrals/ for calendar of clothing distribution dates. -- On designated days: Walk in and take a number for service.
site_schedule: Aug 9-Dec 13, 2023: Wed 8:30am-10am; Select Thurs 4:30pm-6pm; Select Sun 1pm-2:30pm
site_eligibility: Children ages 0-13 -- Living in St. Joseph County -- With household income at or below 130% of the Federal Poverty Level -- With referral from an area school or a social service organization

agency_desc: Robinson Community Learning Center is a neighborhood facility with a variety of community programs and activities. It is open to all with a focus on youth and senior citizens.
site_name: ROBINSON COMMUNITY LEARNING CENTER
service_description: Provides a free 8-session program that helps a child's brain learn communication, build healthy relationships, and social skills.
site_details: Call or visit the website for class times.
site_eligibility: People with children age 3 and younger.

agency_desc: Robinson Community Learning Center is a neighborhood facility with a variety of community programs and activities. It is open to all with a focus on youth and senior citizens.

service_description: Offers neighborhood facility with a variety of community programs and activities for youth. Activities include games, computer learning, youth violence prevention, performing arts, tutoring, and literacy programs. Programs are also available for area seniors, including a book club, fitness activities, and computer classes.

service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items often include blankets, cleaning supplies, towels, and toys. Volunteers to assist with shelter duties, including clerical tasks, are also welcome.
site_details: Call or walk in to make donation arrangements or to inquire about volunteering.
site_eligibility: To Donate: Open -- To Volunteer: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers a shelter for surrendered animals.
site_name: PET REFUGE
service_description: Provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals and rehomes animals through adoption. Offers lost-and-found services. This shelter does not euthanize, so there may be a wait of several weeks to surrender an animal.
site_details: For surrenders: Must fill out the Intake Form For adoptions: Walk in during designated hours or fill out application form online; an application must be submitted and reviewed before a pet may be adopted; this process typically takes 48 hours.
site_eligibility: Vary by service; none to look for a lost animal or report a found animal

agency_desc: REAL Services is the Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 2), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Elkhart, Koscousko, Marshall, Fulton, and St Joseph County. They are also the Community Action Agency for these counties.
site_name: REAL SERVICES - SOUTH BEND HEADQUARTERS
service_description: Offers individual development savings acounts for low-income adults. Participants receive mathching funds for money they save toward buying a home, home rehabilitation, post-secondary education for themselves or a dependent, or starting or expanding a small businees. Asset-specific education is provided during their up to four year participaton to help achieve their goals.
site_details: Call for information; applications must be obtained at the Monthly Information session
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- With income from employment -- At or below 200% of Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: REAL Services is the Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 2), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Elkhart, Koscousko, Marshall, Fulton, and St Joseph County. They are also the Community Action Agency for these counties.
site_name: REAL SERVICES - SOUTH BEND HEADQUARTERS
service_description: Serves as the access point to connect aging and disabled individuals, with physical impairments, to appropriate human services. Area Agencies on Aging are responsible for coordinating, funding, and planning home- and community-based services, which may include;  advocacy, case management, and health care coordination, comprehensive information and referrals, congregate and home-delivered meals, government subsidies issued for supportive living options, and transportation services.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Seniors or persons with disabilities and their family, caregivers, and advocates

agency_desc: REAL Services is the Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 2), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Elkhart, Koscousko, Marshall, Fulton, and St Joseph County. They are also the Community Action Agency for these counties.

service_description: Provides information, referral, and options counseling for seniors and persons of any age with disabilities. Services are tailored to meet each individual family's needs, and referrals to community resources are provided as needed. Limited financial assistance may be available to help complete education needs.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule initial appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 and older -- At or below 125% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: REAL Services is the Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 2), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Elkhart, Koscousko, Marshall, Fulton, and St Joseph County. They are also the Community Action Agency for these counties.
site_name: REAL SERVICES - SOUTH BEND HEADQUARTERS
service_description: Provides transportation for older adults, living in the cities of Granger, Mishawaka, Osceola and South Bend. Rides are available to doctors, grocery shopping, banking, government offices such as Medicaid  and Social Security Offices, and other necessary appointments. The vehicles are not wheelchair accessible.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Limited access to transportation

site_name: REAL SERVICES - SOUTH BEND HEADQUARTERS
service_description: Provides a comprehensive assessment to determine whether nursing home placement is appropriate and provides information about area nursing home options or options for how to remain in the home. In order to receive Medicaid coverage, any person seeking placement in an Indiana nursing facility must complete this Pre-Admission Screening (PAS) evaluation.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an evaluation.
site_eligibility: Seeking placement in a nursing home or options on how to remain in the home

site_name: REAL SERVICES - SOUTH BEND HEADQUARTERS
service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.
site_details: Call for an initial assessment and to schedule a home visit.
site_eligibility: Ages 60 and older or any age with physical disabilities -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance (based on assessment) -- Income requirements vary by funding source

Services may include attic insulation, caulking, weatherstripping, furnace repair or replacement, and heat duct and water pipe insulation.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Applied for the energy assistance program (EAP)

agency_name: INDIANA STATE COURT - ST JOSEPH COUNTY
agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - SMALL CLAIMS COURT - SOUTH BEND
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In St Joseph County, the Superior Court handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in to request claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in St Joseph County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in St Joseph County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in St Joseph County

agency_name: INDIANA STATE COURT - ST JOSEPH COUNTY
agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - CIRCUIT AND SUPERIOR COURTS - SOUTH BEND
service_name: CIRCUIT AND SUPERIOR COURTS - SOUTH BEND
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in St Joseph County. For juror information, contact the jury administration line.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutors office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in St Joseph County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in St Joseph County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in St Joseph County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides referrals to pro-bono attorneys.
site_name: VOLUNTEER LAWYER NETWORK
service_description: Provides referrals for eligible persons to private attorneys for pro-bono representation in civil matters and expungement and drivers license reinstatement cases. Representation is at attorney discretion and is available for divorce, adult guardianship, parental visitation, landlord/tenant issues dealing with substandard housing conditions, predatory debt collection, limited immigration assistance, breached contracts, and bankruptcy for medical fees or public housing.

service_description: Provides curb-to-curb transportation for persons whose physical or mental disabilities prevent them from riding the regular Interurban Trolley in the cities of Elkhart and Goshen. A free Paratransit ADA card is required to access these services.
site_details: Visit the website for a Paratransit ADA application, or call to have an application mailed to you. You may be required to provide a physician's verification of your disability -- All rides must be scheduled by 4pm, one (business) day in advance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Curb-to-Curb: Vary; typically Mon-Fri 5am-8pm; Sat 5am-7pm
site_eligibility: With a physical or mental disability -- Unable to use the regular Interurban Trolley

agency_desc: A regionally accredited, private Catholic university.

service_description: Provides a support group for pregnant women experiencing conflict or violence in an intimate partner relationship. Child care and transportation is available for meetings, and participants are given BABE store coupons and a small infant-care item at each session. This program is part of an ongoing research study; a $400 stipend can be earned for full participation (including postpartum follow-ups).
site_details: Call the office for a phone assessment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 9am-6pm -- Group meeting times vary.
site_eligibility: Currently 10-30 weeks pregnant -- Age 16 or older -- Have experienced conflict with a partner in the past 12 months -- Fluent in English

agency_name: COMPREHENSIVE CREDIT COUNSELING OF RURAL SERVICES OF INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides legal and financial counseling to financially troubled farmers throughout Indiana.  Farm mediation program assists farmers who have received a "non-favorable" opinion from USDA agencies such as Department of Agriculture divisions, Farm Service Agency, Rural Development or Natural Resources Conservation Service.  USDA-approved curriculum available in financial management and recordkeeping.
site_name: COMPREHENSIVE CREDIT COUNSELING OF RURAL SERVICES OF INDIANA
service_description: Provides mediation services to persons directly affected by actions of United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or any Ag-creditor. Mediation is a means for the parties in a dispute to exchange information and explore options for resolution. Services include educating parties on applicable regulations and scheduling informal and formal mediation, at a neutral location.
site_details: Call to request an application or fill one out online. Mailed-in applications are accepted.
site_eligibility: Arbitration -- Living in Indiana -- Farmers or local residents -- Received adverse notices from USDA or any Ag-creditor

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
site_name: MISHAWAKA HOUSING AUTHORITY
service_description: Maintains and operates an income-based public housing complex (Barbee Creek) in St Joseph County to eligible individuals and families. Applications for the wait list are accepted on a walk-in basis. Rent is approximately 30% of adjusted gross income.
site_details: Visit website to apply online -OR- walk in for an application to be placed on the wait list. If out of state or unable to travel to the office, call to request an application mailed. -- Return the completed application during schedule drop-off appointment. -- For information, call the office during business hours.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Drop-off Applications: By appointment only
site_eligibility: Meet low-income guidelines from eligible income sources such as employment (not temporary),   pension, Social Security, SSI, SSD -- No rent or judgment owed to previous landlords -- Satisfactory criminal history (will not accept sex offenders)

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
site_name: MISHAWAKA HOUSING AUTHORITY
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in the city of Mishawaka in St Joseph County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list for the city of Mishawaka is currently CLOSED. No applications are available at this time. -- Those already on the wait list should walk in to update contact information as needed. Contact information can be updated through fax or sent in by mail.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

site_eligibility: Age 50 or older -OR- age 40 or older, if disabled -- Meet low-income guidelines from eligible income sources such as employment, pension, Social Security, SSI, SSD -- No rent or judgment owed to previous landlords -- Satisfactory criminal history (will not accept sex offenders)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency with a mission to increase affordable and sustainable housing opportunities for individuals and families.
site_name: COMMUNITY HOMEBUYERS CORPORATION
service_description: Provides one-on-one coaching to prepare people to become homeowners. Provides education on resolving past credit problems, reducing debt, and saving for a down payment. Also provides low-cost mortgage loans and down payment assistance to low- to moderate-income buyers who qualify. Offers support on the mortgage loan process before and after the purchase.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information or to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Your household income may not exceed 80% of area median income adjusted for household size.  (see website for area median incomes) -- You must be a first-time home buyer, unless: You own a mobile home -- You have been displaced from your current home because of a legal situation -- You have relocated to the area -- You have not owned a home in the past three years -- You have a foreclosure history with extenuating circumstances -- You must have at least $2,000 in cash savings -- Evidence that you have completed a financial management/budget course and pre-purchase counseling

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that matches at-risk youth with adult mentors.
site_name: BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS SOUTHERN LAKE REGION
service_description: Matches children from one parent families in need of support with professionally supported adult mentors who have shared interests. Community-Based Mentors volunteer two to four times per month for at least one year. Site-Based Mentors volunteer once a week for at least 30 minutes at a child's school or community center for at least one full school year.
site_details: To Volunteer: Call or visit website to complete application and pass background checks. -- To Request a Mentor for a Child: Call or complete online application. -- For questions about enrollment: call or email enrollment@becomeabig.com. -- Do not walk in for service; this office is not staffed except during programming.
site_schedule: Available by phone: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Services are provided weekends, evening, and out-of-school times.
site_eligibility: Adult Mentors: Age 18 or older -- Youth Participants: Ages 6-17 at time of enrollment in primarily single-parent homes (may stay in program to age 18)

site_name: BENDIX BUILDING AND MAIN OFFICE
service_description: Serves as a designated testing site for the High School Equivalency Test (HiSET) in St. Joseph County. Exam is available in English or Spanish languages as well as computer and paper formats. Accommodations can be arranged for students with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information or to register for a testing date. -- Payment is expected upon registration.
site_schedule: Registration Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Testing on select dates only; call or see website for details.
site_eligibility: Have lived in Indiana for minimum of 30 days before taking test -- Have not already earned a diploma from an accredited US high school -- Age 16 or older (special documentation required for anyone under age 18)

agency_desc: A nonprofit community development corporation involved in inner-city residential and commercial revitalization. It initiates a variety of programs to stop the physical, economic, and social decline in these neighborhoods. It focuses primarily on low-income census tracts of urban South Bend.
site_name: SOUTH BEND HERITAGE FOUNDATION
service_description: Provides financial counseling, education, and advice on a range of housing issues, including first-time homebuyer education, post-purchase mortgage counseling, financial planning for renters, private and government-sponsored financing, and the use of tax incentives in rehabilitation projects.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government organization that administers housing assistance programs.
site_name: SOUTH BEND HOUSING AUTHORITY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in the city of South Bend in St Joseph County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list is currently closed. -- No applications are available at this time. -- Those already on the wait list should call or visit the website to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is closed, income guidelines will be posted. -- Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: A government organization that administers housing assistance programs.
site_name: SOUTH BEND HOUSING AUTHORITY
service_description: Maintains and operates thirteen public housing complexes and 814 single-family homes and public housing units throughout the city of South Bend for eligible low-income families, seniors, and persons with disabilities. Applications are accepted on a walk-in basis for the wait list. Rent amount is equal to 30% of the resident's adjusted gross income.
site_details: Walk in or visit website for information. www.hasbonline.com
site_eligibility: US citizens and eligible immigrants -- Income at or below 80% of the area median income -- With satisfactory criminal history, credit history, and rental history -- Preference given to persons who are homeless, or dislocated disaster victims of federally declared disasters

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of South Bend in St. Joseph County.
site_name: SOUTH BEND -  ANIMAL CONTROL
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in South Bend, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, humane euthanasia for pets, and adoption for homeless dogs and cats. Issues pet licenses in the corporate city limits of South Bend.
site_details: To report an animal violation (stray, endangered, etc.): Call the Service Center at 3-1-1 to report. -- For after-hours emergencies: calls are routed to the Animal Control Officer on duty. -- To surrender an animal: Walk in during shelter hours. -- To claim an impounded animal: Walk in. -- To adopt: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Shelter: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm -- Service Center: Mon-Fri 7:30am-5:30pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: To report an animal concern or surrender a pet: Living in the corporate city limits of South Bend in St. Joseph County; does not accept animals from any 5 digit addresses

site_schedule: Mon-Fri 7:30am-5:30pm -- Parks: daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of South Bend in St. Joseph County.
site_name: SOUTH BEND - COMMUNITY INVESTMENT DEPARTMENT
service_description: Provides one-time assistance for home repairs for eligible owner-occupied households in the city of  South Bend in Saint Joseph County. Eligible repairs for homes through the program ONLY include a new roof and/or furnace. The final determination of eligible repairs will be based on a required program inspection. Assistance will be provided on a first come, first served basis until all applications are processed or until all available funds are committed, whichever occurs first.
site_details:
Visit www.southbendin.gov/south-bend-home-repair to complete pre-screening. -- To determine location eligibility, enter home address on the application website. -- Pre-screening also available `by calling 574-235-5915 -OR- visit the Department of Community Investment Neighborhoods Office located on 13th floor of the County-City Building. -- If you meet pre-screening requirements, program guidelines and an application will be sent to you. -- Applications must be received by the program staff no later than June 19, 2023 at 5pm. No applications will be accepted after the deadline. Applications with a postmark prior to June 19th but received after the deadline will NOT be considered. 

For UAP: If you are not currently enrolled, you can still begin the application process for the Home Repair Program. However, you must be enrolled prior to being determined eligible for home repair assistance. To start the UAP application process visit www.southbendin.gov/uap or call 3-1-1.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of South Bend in St. Joseph County -- Own and occupied the home -- At or below 80% of the Area Median Income (AMI) -- Must be enrolled in the South Bend Utility Assistance Program (UAP) -- Current on property taxes -- Must carry home owners insurance

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of South Bend in St. Joseph County.
site_name: SOUTH BEND - DIVISION OF UTILITIES
service_description: The City of South Bend provides a reduction of up to $25.50 per month for water and sewer bills to those who are eligible. Monthly discount may last for up to one year and applicants must reapply every year.
site_details: Visit website, https://www.southbendin.gov, to apply online, or call 3-1-1. -- Once application submitted, residents will be notified within 2-3 weeks if approved; may take up to two (2) billing cycles before credit appears on bills; and credit will be applied every month for a year.
site_eligibility: Have a South Bend utility account in resident's name -- Receive sewer service from the city of South Bend -- Be at or below 80% of the area median income (AMI); >0%-30% AMI receives $22.50 credit; >30-45% AMI receives $19.25 credit; >45-60% AMI receives $14.25 credit; and >60-80% AMI receives $8.00 credit

site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of St Joseph County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, and tattoo parlors in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in St Joseph County.
site_name: ST JOSEPH COUNTY CLERK
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in St Joseph County.
site_name: ST JOSEPH COUNTY CLERK
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves St Joseph County

service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. agency_desc: A public university offering four-year and post-graduate education.
site_name: INDIANA UNIVERSITY SOUTH BEND DENTAL HYGIENE CLINIC
service_description: Provides low-cost examinations and preventative dental services to adults and children over age 5. Procedures are performed by students and supervised by licensed dentists and dental hygienists. Available services include teeth cleanings, oral cancer screenings, fluoride treatments, sealants, and dental X-rays. No extractions, fillings, or other repair work are available. Clinic hours vary each fall and spring semester and a waitlist is possible.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment and to be put on waitlist.
site_eligibility: Adults and children age 5 and over

agency_desc: A public university offering four-year and post-graduate education.
site_name: NAVARI STUDENT OUTREACH CLINIC
service_description: Provides free preventative and acute health care services to persons in need. The clinic is staffed by university students under faculty supervision. Services include physicals, health screenings, chronic disease control, laboratory tests, STD screenings, pregnancy tests, and limited pharmaceutical services. Referrals to area medical and social services agencies are also offered.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment and leave a detailed message including your contact information and why you need to be seen.
site_eligibility: Open; primarily serves the city of South Bend

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering transitional housing, in South Bend, for recent ex-offenders transitioning from incarceration to the community.
site_name: DISMAS HOUSE OF SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides transitional living for men and women released from prison or jail in the past year. Case management and support services are available for the duration of the program. Housing is shared with college students to promote the transition back into society. Length of program typically ranges from ninety days to two years. Upon arrival, residents are expected to abide by house rules and search for employment.
site_details: Call to request an application. Application will be sent with instructions.
site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 10am-5pm; Fri by appointment -- Intake Appointments: Mon-Thurs 10am-5pm
site_eligibility: Men or women -- Age 18 or older -- Released from prison or jail in the past 12 months -- Without charge for sex offense or arson -- Must not be actively using drugs or alcohol, prefers 30 days sobriety -- Agree that agency can verify release information with Parole District

service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call or visit the website for information. www.mphpl.org
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-6pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm; Sat 10am-5pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Harris and Penn Townships in St Joseph County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: MISHAWAKA LIBRARY
service_description: Offers monthly delivery of requested library materials (as they are available) to St Joseph County residents who are homebound due to chronic or extended illness, physical disability, or extreme transportation problems.
site_details: Call to request service.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-6pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm; Sat 10am-5pm -- Book Deliveries: By request
site_eligibility: Living in Penn or Harris Township in St Joseph County -- Homebound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: MEMORIAL HOSPITAL OF SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who have received or are receiving care from Memorial Hospital of South Bend. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. Call the Patient Accounts office to request a Financial Evaluation form, download from the website, or pick up at the Hospital Cashier window.
site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from Memorial Hospital of South Bend (or guarantor of someone who received such services)

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: BABE STORE - NORTH LAFAYETTE BOULEVARD
service_description: Provides an incentive program that encourages pregnant women and new parents to access social service, health care, and educational programs. Clients earn coupons received from schools, clinics, doctors, and social service agencies that can be redeemed for baby supplies (such as diapers, infant and toddler clothing, cribs, high chairs, strollers, potty chairs, baby bathtubs, and car seats). No money is exchanged at the stores, only coupons.
site_details: Call BABE Store for upcoming class schedule or coupon provider information, or walk in to redeem earned coupons.
site_eligibility: Have incentive coupons

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: BABE STORE - NORTH LAFAYETTE BOULEVARD
service_description: Provides a smoking cessation program with individualized counseling for pregnant women. Requires four prenatal meetings during pregnancy and then monthly meetings after delivery. Clients may select a smoking support partner, who resides with them, to enroll.  Participants who remain smoke-free throughout the pregnancy and first year of the baby's birth may each qualify for a $25 diaper voucher each month, to be redeemed at participating Walmarts.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- Pregnant women, with or without a smoking support partner (living in same household) -- Currently smoking or smoked at least 3 months prior to pregnancy -- Willing to quit smoking and submit to a breath/saliva test

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
site_name: WOMEN'S CARE CENTER - NORTH NOTRE DAME SOUTH BEND
service_name: BABY FOOD - NORTH NOTRE DAME SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides a one-time assistance for baby formula during emergencies for families with infants. Recurring assistance is available for those participating in other services at this location.
site_details: Call to schedule a pick-up for baby formula during emergencies.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm; Sat 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: With an infant in the household on supplemental feeding -- In emergency or first time seeking assistance from this agency for baby formula

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
site_name: WOMEN'S CARE CENTER - NORTH NOTRE DAME SOUTH BEND
service_name: FAMILY PLANNING - NORTH NOTRE DAME SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides free, walk-in pregnancy testing, pregnancy verification required for medical benefits, and referrals to prenatal care, adoption agencies, and other abortion alternatives for women facing a crisis pregnancy. No referrals are made to abortion service providers.
site_details: Walk-ins accepted; calling ahead is recommended.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm; Sat 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: Women

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
site_name: WOMEN'S CARE CENTER - NORTH NOTRE DAME SOUTH BEND
service_name: PARENTING EDUCATION - NORTH NOTRE DAME SOUTH BEND
service_description: Provides parenting and childbirth education programs for parents and expectant parents. Participants earn coupons that can be redeemed at Crib Club for baby and maternity items. Classes are available in-person as well as online zoom classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment or to find out about upcoming classes.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm; Sat 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and parents of children age 5 or younger

service_description: Provides diapers, baby clothing (up to size 5T), and maternity clothing for new and expectant mothers in need. agency_desc: A congressional body of the United States, made up of representatives from each state proportional to population.
site_name: INDIANA'S 2ND DISTRICT
service_name: UNITED STATES REPRESENTATIVE - INDIANA'S 2ND DISTRICT - RUDY YAKYM - REPUBLICAN
service_description: Represents the 2nd Congressional District of northern and north central Indiana in the US House of Representatives. Constituents may contact their representatives with questions or concerns about current or pending legislation. Representative's office may be able to help citizens in navigating the complex federal agency system, such as the Social Security Administration, the Department of Veterans Affairs, the Internal Revenue Service, or any other federal agency.
site_details: Call, write, fax, or email questions, comments, concerns, or other feedback. Submit email through the website.
site_schedule: Indiana Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Washington DC Office: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Correspondence is only accepted from persons living in Indiana's Second District

service_description: Provides outpatient primary medical services, substance abuse treatment, and mental health care including veteran reintegration and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) counseling for area veterans and their dependents.

agency_name: CHILDREN'S THERAPY INNOVATIONS DEVELOPMENTAL REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A commercial organization providing up to 24-hour care in the home of residents with developmental limitations. Structured family caregiver assistance also provided for residents who qualify for the Medicaid Waiver.
site_name: CHILDREN'S THERAPY INNOVATIONS DEVELOPMENTAL REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
service_description: Offers a live-in caregiver model that enables a relative or loved one to provide direct personal care for an aging or disabled family member. Caregivers receive coaching, education, a monthly stipend, and assistance in accessing needed resources by their care team.
site_details: CICOA staff conduct preliminary phone assessments and referrals for initial home visit to confirm eligibility for funding.
site_eligibility: Care recipient must be 18 or older -- Consumer and caregiver must reside in the same residence

agency_desc: An accredited, commercial organization that offers guidance, financial assistance and overall support to caregivers providing care to loved ones.
site_name: MAKING A DIFFERENCE
service_description: Offers a live-in caregiver model that enables a relative or loved one to provide direct personal care for an aging or disabled family member. Caregivers receive coaching, education, a monthly stipend, and assistance in accessing needed resources by their Care Team. Services provide a person-centered care plan that sustains independence in a community setting.
site_details: Recipient will receive a preliminary phone assessment and referral for initial home visit to confirm eligibility for funding. Contingent on eligibility, plan of care is developed which will include Structured Family Caregiving and ongoing case-management.
site_eligibility: Care Recipient must be 18 or older -- Meeting guidelines for the Medicaid Waiver level of care
